title: Thomas McDonalds New Book Im Tellin is a Revealing Look into the Horrid Cycle of Racial Separation that is Rampant in the United States Armed Forces.
text:
Recent release “I’m Tellin’” from Page Publishing author Thomas McDonald is a powerful narrative of dealing with training, possible deployments, personal problems, being married to a spouse as well as the military, and then also having to handle unnecessary racial tensions.
(PRWEB) October 23, 2015
Thomas McDonald, a proud US veteran, has completed his new book “I’m Tellin’”: an exposing and informative account of the trials and tribulations soldiers encounter due to the color of their skin.
“Fighting an ageless race war within a war, but not choosing sides is too much for anyone to bear.” says McDonald.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Thomas McDonald’s compelling tale shares situations and adversity that were met with nothing short of courage and generosity.
Mr. McDonald served his country for almost 14 years and went through his share of troubles and persecution as a soldier, as well as a non-commissioned officer, with the determination he developed prior to joining the military. He stood strong when challenging his Superior's wit and wrongdoings when it came to mistreatment, not only as a soldier, but a human being. No matter where he was stationed, he upheld the highest standards for himself and all those around him even when times were hard. He left the door open to be friends with those who wronged him. A personal sacrifice was made to directly or indirectly cause those to abide by not only military regulation but God given rights.
Mr. McDonald didn't think he would be too black to serve, and not black enough to fit in which mirrored his father’s military experience. Thomas had friends from both races end their lives because of the adversity. If nothing is done, this cycle will never be broken. McDonald’s mind and life are forever altered.
Readers who wish to experience this enlightening work can purchase “I’m Tellin’” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
